GapFillInput.Title: Past Perfect
GapFillInput.Instruction: Look at the sequence of events. Put the verb in brackets into the correct form in the gap (Past Simple or Past Perfect). Type the answer in the gap. Use contractions if necessary.
GapFillInput.ContentGapFillInput:
1She was thirsty. She bought a drink.
EShe was thirsty so she boughta drink. (buy)
2The town changed. I didn't recognise it.
EI didn't recognise the town because it had changed. (change)
3I didn't finish my exam on time. The teacher gave me an extra five minutes.
EThe teacher gave me an extra five minutes because I hadn't finished. (not finish)
4The salesman sold the last bicycle. John arrived at the bike shop.
EBy the time John arrived, the salesman had soldthe last bicycle already. (sell)
5He broke his finger. He continued playing the game.
EHe didn't stop playing even though he had broken|'d brokenhis finger. (break)
6She heard the bad news. She phoned her father.
EWhen she heard the bad news, she calledher father. (call)
7I didn't like the town. I only stayed there two months.
EI didn't like the town so I movedafter two months. (move)
8We went for walk. We missed your call.
EWe missed your call because we had gone|'d gonefor a walk. (go)
9I saw the film. I didn't want to go to the cinema.
EI didn't want to go to the cinema because I had seen|'d seenthe film already. (see)
10The programme started. We switched on the TV.
EWhen we switched on the TV, the programmehad started. (start)
